title: Intake Officer
description: Manage intake workflows, screening tools, and diversion paths.

title: Prosecutor
description: Evaluate petitions, diversion eligibility, and case severity.

title: Defense Attorney
description: Advocate for the youth’s legal rights and negotiate alternatives to detention.

title: Judge
description: Review risk levels, make disposition decisions, and log outcomes.

title: Guardian / Parent
description: Sign forms, provide support, and participate in decisions about the youth.

title: Probation Officer
description: Supervise youth, assign terms, and track compliance after court decisions.

title: Diversion Specialist
description: Administer informal adjustment agreements and monitor youth compliance.

title: Residential Staff
description: Handle care, supervision, and programming within placement facilities.

title: Mental Health Specialist
description: Provide mental health evaluations, referrals, and treatment oversight.

title: Community Advocate
description: Represent mentoring programs and local support agencies in the youth’s plan.

title: Educator
description: Monitor school attendance, IEPs, and connect youth to educational support.

title: Reentry Coordinator
description: Plan youth transition back to the community and coordinate support services.

title: Workforce Agent
description: Link youth to job training, apprenticeships, and career coaching.
